definition: don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Many conservatives concluded that democracy itself was at fault.
sentences.chinese: 保守派人士就此盖棺定论，一切都是民主本身的问题。

sentences.english: That is, of course, if they ever get to the altar.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这得等到两大交易所联姻成功才能盖棺定论。

sentences.english: Still, it may be a little early to get out the coffin for Newsweek.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这样对其盖棺定论显得为时尚早。

sentences.english: History was safer than the news, because there was no question of how it would end.
sentences.chinese: 历史比新闻保险的多，因为一切都已盖棺定论。

definition: don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
a genius in retrospect (idiom); hindsight is 20-20
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
see 成則為王，敗則為寇|成则为王，败则为寇[cheng2 ze2 wei2 wang2 , bai4 ze2 wei2 kou4]
